articles.title: Watch: US-Russia Prisoner Swap On Airport Tarmac, Basketball Star Freed - NDTV
articles.description: American basketball star Brittney Griner was headed back to the United States on Thursday after being released from a Russian prison in exchange for an arms dealer known as the "Merchant of Death."
articles.content:
President Joe Biden announced Griner's release early Thursday.

articles.title: Who is Paul Whelan, the former US marine who has been detained in Russia since 2018? - ABC News
articles.description: As news broke that US basketball star Brittney Griner had been released from Russian prison in exchange for arms dealer Viktor Bout, US officials didn't mince words: "This was not a choice of which American to bring home".

articles.author: Jennifer Hansler
articles.title: Exclusive: Paul Whelan tells CNN he is 'disappointed' that more has not been done to secure his release - CNN
articles.description: Detained American Paul Whelan expressed his frustration that more has not been done to secure his release in an exclusive CNN interview hours after another detained American, Brittney Griner, was freed.

articles.title: Biden invites Buhari, others to US-African leaders summit - Punch Newspapers
articles.description: President of the United States of America, Joe Biden, has invited 49 African Heads of State and the head of the African Union for a three-day US-Africa Leaders Summit.
articles.content:
